text: Michael Henderson (July 7, 1951 â€“ July 19, 2022) was an American bass guitarist and singer-songwriter. He was known for his work with Miles Davis in the early 1970s. He was also known for his fusion albums such as Jack Johnson, Live-Evil, and Agharta. Henderson died on July 19, 2022 in Atlanta, Georgia, two weeks after his 71st birthday. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American bass guitarists Category:American R&B; singers Category:American jazz singers Category:American funk singers Category:American soul singers Category:American pop singers Category:Singers from Mississippi Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:Writers from Mississippi Category:People from Yazoo City, Mississippi
title: Michael Henderson
